Name: Jurassic World Volcano Escape Game
Description:
It’s a race against time to see whose dinosaurs can make their way around the gameboard and into their boats to safety. Watch out for rolling lava balls and an irascible T-Rex that’s ready to block your moves.
(back of box copy)

A game for young children based off of the volcano scene in Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom. It plays similarly to Parcheesi. The goal is to get all four of your dinosaur pawns off the island and onto your boat before the other players.

There is a custom die that features the numbers 1-5, and a picture of a t-rex. On your turn, you roll the die, and if you get a number, you either move the number of spaces indicated or choose to use the turn to instead put the rolled number of lava balls into play in the volcano. The volcano piece will randomly shoot the balls out to different parts of the board, and pieces hit by the lava balls must go back to start.

If you roll the t-rex, you may move the non-player t-rex pawn to part of the board. Players can't pass by the t-rex and get two turns to try to move the t-rex. If you don't roll and move the t-rex in these two turns, that pawn must go back to start.

-user summary

Name: Rendita
Description:
The players roll two dice and combine the results of the roll into a two digit number (red = tens , black = ones). So red 1 and black 6 combines into 16. This would allow the player to buy commodity 16 if no one else has already done this. If another player already owns the commodity the player has to pay a fee. There are 3 different commodities: shops (black letters), restaurants (red letters) and a cinema (Filmpalast).

A player owning a shop may make further investments to increase the fees he gets from the other players if it's number is rolled again. The fees for restaurants are increased if a player owns 2 or 3 restaurants in adjacent buildings. Fees for the cinema are only payed if a player owns both halves (space 63 and 64). If a player owns only one half, another player may still buy the other half or even the half already in possession. When a player owns the whole cinema it is opened and the fees increase automatically every time it's number is rolled, without the player having to invest any money.

If a double is rolled, an event occurs that causes the player to lose or gain money.

The game ends after a fixed playing time or if all players but one go bankrupt. The last remaining player or the player with the most money and the most valuable commodities wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Green With Evil
Description:
The Green with Evil kickstarter exclusive expansion for the Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid board game expands your game with new enemies. Including some of the most iconic foes the Mighty Morphin’ Power Rangers ever faced!

Components:

1 x Scorpina Master villain
1 x Evil Green Ranger
12 x Tenga Warriors foot soldiers
2 x Location boards

—description from the publisher

It can still be acquired through the Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Kickstarter Exclusives Deluxe Box.
Families: Game: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid

Name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – White Light
Description:
The White Light exclusive kickstarter expansion for the Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid board game brings in one of the greatest heroes and one of the greatest villains in Power Rangers history!

Components:

1 x White Ranger hero character (comes with 10 Combat cards, 1 character card and 1 Zord card)
1 x Lord Zedd Master villain (comes with 8 Master cards and 1 Deployment card)
12 x Z Putty Patrollers foot soldiers (comes with 10 Deployment cards and 10 Foot Soldier cards)
2 x Location boards

—description from the publisher

It can still be acquired through the Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Kickstarter Exclusives Deluxe Box.
Families: Game: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid

Name: Warmaster Chess 2000. vol. 3
Description:
New counters and rules for Warmaster Chess 2000, like Mines, Mountains and Nukes.

Published in 1998 and contained in Command magazine #51

Name: Warmaster Chess 2000: Variants
Description:
Published in Command # 52-53, adds new rules and counters for the base game: Hq's, Infantry, Tanks, Artillery, Mg's or Airborne, Bulldozers and Phalanx.

It's based in an article of a Russian chess magazine of year 1933, by A.S. Yurgecevich.

—user summary

Name: Monolith Arena: Academics
Description:
Academics, the first Army Pack for Monolith Arena, includes a new army and a new type of experience for Monolith Arena players. The Academics are a focused, well-trained army. They have a lot of runes and upgrades in their tile deck. They also excel in weakening the enemy – their banner slows down opponent tiles! Their units are few, but strong. Be prepared to lead the new Academics army into the fray on the Monolith Arena!

—description from publisher

Name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Sand Runners
Description:
Sand Runners are the remaining forces that were once sent to face Moloch at the very beginning... A bunch of nut-cases who lost their minds during that time. They’re loose cannons with a light approach to their life, but don’t let that fool you, they are persistent. Some may think - well, but that’s all? The very moment people believe that they know everything there is to know about them, the most bizarre things happen... things that are unexplainable...

The main advantage of this army is its ability to turn off the fundamental board space during the Battle with the use of Sandstorm. Some Sand Runner Warriors have Features like Modules which helps them support each other during Battles. Additionally, the HQ is double-sided, which allows it to eliminate a single, slower threat before it attacks. Their disadvantage is their low starting initiative, and the fact that an unfortunate change of the HQ side may result in the inability to kill adjacent units during the Battle.

—description from the publisher

Name: Das Labyrinth des Pharao: Die Mumien-Erweiterung
Description:
The mummies are placed per player in a pyramid corner of the respective right neighbor. Once the third pyramid tiles are laid, the researchers must be placed irrevocably at the entrance of your choice.

Whenever a chip with a scarab has to be placed during the course of the game, the dice is then rolled and the mummies are moved accordingly within the respective neighboring pyramid.

When a mummy hits an already placed treasure, the mummy steals it and returns the loot back to the stolen player's supply.

The latter will have no choice but to place such a treasure again later, but that could possibly also be of advantage, as experienced pyramid researchers will already imagine

- - -

Die Mumien werden je Spieler in einer Pyramidenecke des jeweils rechten Nachbarn platziert. Sobald die dritten Pyramidenplattchen gelegt, die Forscher also am Eingang Ihrer Wahl unwiderruflich platziert werden müssen.

Immer, wenn im weiteren Spielverlauf dann ein Plättchen mit Skarabäus gelegt werden muß, wird hernach der Würfel geworfen und die Mumien entsprechend innerhalb der jeweiligen Nachbar-Pyramide bewegt.

Stößt eine Mumie dabei auf einen bereits platzierten Schatz, stielt die Mumie diesen, und gibt das Raubgut wieder in den Vorrat des bestohlenen Spielers zurück.

Letzterem bleibt zwar nichts anderes, als solch einen Schatz später erneut zu platzieren, aber das könnte ggf. ja auch mal von Vorteil sein, wie erfahrenere Pyramidenforscher/innen sich bereits ausmalen werden  =])..

Name: GOFO
Description:
GOFO is Go Fish on steroids and crack.  Players collect books of the finer things in life, like: beer, pizza, weed, whips, switchblades, money, human skulls and drugs.  There are also four special function cards that add strategy and fun.  GOFO is intended for mature audiences.

—description from the publisher

Name: Panoply: Classical Ancients Miniatures Rules
Description:
Miniatures wargames rules for the Classical and Hellenistic periods, ca 500 - 50 BC. One figure represents a hundred men, one inch on the table represents about 30 yards on the battlefield, and one turn represents about 15 minutes of real time. The rules use written orders and may be characterized as "Old School".

GROUND SCALE: One inch equals approximately thirty yards.
FIGURE SCALE: One casting represents one hundred soldiers.
TIME SCALE: One period of tabletop movement with all its associated or resulting actions, represents 15 minutes of actual time.

The rulebook includes army lists for Greeks, Romans, Carthaginians, Persians, and Macedonians.

Name: A Night Out: the party game!
Description:
A Night Out is a quick and fun party game, that takes around 45 minutes each round.

The aim of the game is to collect 5 drinks that correspond with your player quality, and collect 1 going home card.

You'll be able to visit 5 locations, have 6 playable characters and dozens of action and drink cards!

Each turn, players:

     Pick 1 token or action card
     Can play up to 2 action cards
     Are able to buy or exchange 1 drink card


The action- and going home cards are shuffled in 1 deck. This means action is guaranteed, and you’ll need to balance your choices between token or action cards!

—description from the designer

Name: Bioviva Junior
Description:
3 challenges, all using images, inspired by the original Bioviva game and adapted for ages 5 and upward. Through miming, challenges, and location tests, younger children will have fun while also learning about the animals that live on the Earth’s many iconic regions! 2 to 4 players. From age 5. Made in France.

-publisher description

Environmental trivia for kids ages 5 and up. Through mimes, challenges, and localization tests, the youngest will discover the Earth, its emblematic places, and its animals. Parents will lead their children to learn how to read a map and better know their favorite animals, earning points with every good answer.

—user summary

Name: Where's Waldo? Memory Game
Description:
Kazaam! Can you remember where I am? Waldo's wacky hotel has pairs of "guests"! Remember who is in what window...and find the match! Don't forget! Match the most and you win!

When a player makes a match for either Waldo or Wenda guest cards, he or she gets a FREE TURN token proving a match for Waldo or Wenda. The FREE TURN can be taken at any time during the game after any player has completed his or her normal turn. A player's FREE TURN is in addition to his or her normal turn.

Name: RUSH 81 Color
Description:
The excitement of RUSH 81 begins with the anticipation of competing against friends and family. There are 81 puzzle pieces, each with a unique position every time you play. The challenge is to finish your hand first while others at the table RUSH to finish tiers. You might think you're right when you make your move - but you will RUSH to take it back when the game reveals that you're wrong.

Concentration, strategy, speed, and sometimes luck contribute to the most sensational board game every devolved - RUSH 81. You will RUSH to finish one game and you will RUSH to start another. A new RUSH begins every time you play. Grab your seat now and prepare for RUSH 81!

—description from the publisher

Name: Fraud: The Game of White-Collar Crime
Description:
2-6 player card game that satirizes corporate greed and white-collar criminals. Can be played in teams of 2 as well.

As a crooked CEO of a phony multi-national corporation, your mission in Fraud is to collect and bank Asset and Liability Cards in your Offshore Account, play Fraud Cards to attack your opponents, use Defense Cards to fend off attacks and avoid collecting Indictments. Once a player receives their 2nd indictment, they have to do the "Perp Walk" around the table while other players heckle them.  The player who first banks $150 million ($150M) in Assets in their Offshore Account before receiving their 3rd indictment - wins the game.

Each card features unique, hand-drawn caricatures and art by Rick Parker.  Rick’s probably best known as the artist of MTV's Beavis and Butt-Head Comic Book, and was on the staff at Marvel Comics for many years. Rick was the perfect man for job - supremely talented comic artist, and a really shady character.

Each player selects a CEO business card as their identity and gets a score pad to keep track of banked Assets and Liabilities in their Offshore Account ($150M wins the game) and indictments (3 strikes and you’re out).

The deck is shuffled and 6 cards are dealt to each player.  The remaining cards are placed face down in the Draw pile.  Played cards are discarded into a Discard pile, which can be shuffled and reused when the Draw pile gets low.

In any given turn, a player has 1 of 5 options: 

     Bank an Asset Card in their Offshore Account.
     Securitize Liability Cards and if successful, bank those as assets in their Offshore Account on the following turn.
     Attack another player with a Fraud Card and if successful, bank 1 Asset Card from you opponent while opponent also gets 1 indictment. Attacks are defended with Defense Cards.
     Discard an unwanted card and draw back to 6.
     Audit another player – each player can do this only once per game.


Fraud has been thoroughly play-tested, improved and refined over 10 years from initial beta launch in 2010 until this final game release. Fraud uses some of the similar game mechanics of Mille Bornes, the attacking, defending style card game that is listed in the GAMES Magazine Hall of Fame.  Fraud is fun, simple to learn, and takes only 30 minutes to play.   The game combines strategy and luck and satirizes corporate greed and white-collar crime.

—description from the publisher

Name: LULU' L'ANGELO TRA I FIORI GIOCO
Description:
Game based on the anime TV series Lulu the angel among the flowers (original name Hana no Ko Runrun 1979).

The aim of the game is to wander from one country to another collecting seeds and then collect the flowers from them. The game will end when the first player who collects all the flowers in his garden, including those that border the other (the other players), and will have discovered the Magic flower (with the colors of the Rainbow).

On his turn, the three cubes are rolled and his marker is moved by how many colors correspond to the base of their triangular markers, received at the beginning of the game. When you happen on a city, you take the corresponding counter from the deck (seeds).

During the course of the game, you will collect several seeds that are placed on their right outside the game plan. Sowing can be attempted when stopping or passing over the Celi box. We turn the record of how many seeds we own at that time. If the character in the slot of the disk is green then you can sow in your garden (friend of Lulù), if it is red (Enemy), you will have to resitituire all seeds collected so far.

When the player has finished sowing on his own garden or passes on the Paris box, he can collect his own flowers.

Game content: a game plan, 4 LuLuù counters of four colors,50 double-sided scented cards,1 cardboard rotating disc,3 cubes with colored faces (dice),9 triangular markers (3 per player).

The cards depicting the flowers on one side and the seeds on the other ... rubbing the part of the seed gives off the scent of the corresponding flower.

Name: Trevi
Description:
Summary
1. Board game , inspired by Trevi Fountain, is a good game for family which uses simple calculation. 
2. You have to play ‘fountain cards’ to reach specific ‘lucky number’ and get ‘lucky token’.
3. Recommendations: Ages 8+ (Simple addition and subtraction ability is required.), 2~5 Players, 20~30 Min. to play.

Components
1. Fountain cards: 80 Cards
2. Starting cards: 4 Cards
3. Round cards: 15 Cards
4. Lucky token: 40 Tokens
5. Highest combo card: 1 Card

Preparations
1. Put 4 starting cards on the board side by side. Number ‘7’ is written on starting cards. 
2. Shuffle fountain cards well and distribute 7 cards to each player. You should NOT show off your own cards to others.
3. Make a deck with remaining cards. 
4. Gather all lucky tokens in one place.
5. Shuffle 15 round cards and select random 5 cards to build round deck. Only 5 chosen cards will be used in this game.
6. Show off the top card of round deck. Check the written number of token and place lucky tokens of that number next to round card.
7. Start the game. The person who see fountain most recently is the first player.

There has ONLY 2 options! Play or Draw!
On your turn, there has 2 options. 
Play the cards to earn points or Draw the cards to fill your hands. After that, your turn is over.

Action #1. Play the card(s). (Color match or Number match)
Play the card(s) of your hand on the board.
To do so, you must match color or number with current base card.
Every time you play a card, current base card will be replaced to the last card you play. 
(In other words, base card will be changed every time you play a card.)
You can play card again and again if color or number is same with replaced base card. Regardless of sign, number is matter. (‘-4’ and ‘4’ are ‘number matched’ in this game.)
You cannot play cards on multiple area. You can only play ONE sequence of cards.

Point!
Current base card changes every time someone plays a card to last played card. You can play cards again and again if color or number is matched.
Because starting cards is ‘7’ and there has no ‘7’ in fountain cards, the first play must be ‘color match’.

Action #2. Draw the cards. (Draw 2 cards from deck)
You don’t want to or can’t play card(s), draw 2 cards form deck to hand. 
All player can hold cards up to 7. If you are holding more cards, discard any card(s) to make 7 cards in your hand. Discarded card(s) will not be used in this game.

To get ‘Lucky Token’…!?
Round card shows 2 information, ‘Lucky number’ and ‘Lucky token’. ‘Lucky number’ is goal of this round.
‘Lucky token’ is reward of this round. 
After player finishes card playing, add all number from base card to last card. If result is same with ‘lucky number’ of this round, that player can earn ‘lucky token’ per each card that he (or she) plays.
Even though player plays more cards than remaining token, player can earn remaining ‘lucky token’ only.
Before end of turn, put together all cards that player plays and put the last card on the top of pile to notice what is current base card. 
When all ‘lucky token’ is distributed of this round, show off next top card of round deck and place written number of ‘lucky token’.

Point!
Strategically, play as many cards as possible to earn more and give as less earning chance as possible to others.

The end of game
When all ‘lucky token’ of 5 rounds is distributed, the game ends immediately. 
If you are holding cards at the end of the game, that gives you a penalty.
Discard your ‘lucky token’ per each card you have. 
Who has token most is the winner of this game.

Point!
You have to manage your fountain cards if you think end is coming!

Name: Cruel Seas: Rulebook
Description:
Cruel Seas is a fast-paced tabletop game recreating the swirling naval dogfights taking place on the seas during the dark days of the Second World War.

Powerful, well-armed boats manned by skilled crews stalk enemy shipping lanes, lying in wait for an unsuspecting target to present itself. With a roar of engines the motor torpedo boats would surge forward, opening up with tracer fire from an arsenal of machine guns and autocannons. If the enemy vessel was a large enough target, torpedoes would also be loosed to deal a devastating blow to their prey.

The game covers six major nationalities - the British Royal Navy, German Kriegsmarine, US Navy, Imperial Japanese Navy, Soviet Navy, and Italian Regia Marina - each having their own character and play style. This rulebook explains how to organize your chosen fleet and take the fight to your opponent as you seek to rule the waves. The vessels vary in size and shape - from fast, sleek killers to slower but more heavily armed ships. Do you prefer a swarm of small but fast boats, fewer larger ships with heavy weaponry to bring to bear, or a combination of these two categories? Cruel Seas provides a multitude of ship and aircraft options and plenty of options to customize your boats' weaponry, making each game different.

Cruel Seas is scenario-driven providing a strong narrative element to your games. From easy-to-play introductory scenarios to more demanding operations that will provide a test of both your skills and nerves!

Name: Mijnwerkers
Description:
Everyone who plays is a miner. Every turn you take a card and look at it. Nobody is allowed to see your card. Then everybody says if they have coal or gold (you are allowed to lie about it). The key is to get gold without anyone knowing. When you manage to do that you steal the gold and keep it for yourself. When you fail this you lose a life and the gold. You are out of the game when you lose all your lives. You win the game if you managed to get the most gold.

There are some cards with some special effects which makes the game more interesting.

Name: Emoción!
Description:
Illustrated deck of cards designed to expand our Emotional Vocabulary in which 12 families of emotions are represented, each composed of 5 levels of intensity.

The manual explains two ways to play, but on its website there are other forms made by amateurs. All of them are based on luck, the management of the hand and / or the interaction between players.

There are two basic ways to play:


     Throw your card from the same family of emotions as the one on the table, or with the same intensity.
     Like other games in which "families" appear, we can also play by placing the different families, similar to the Reihe.


In the two main ways of playing, who wins is the one who runs out of cards in his hand.

Clearly it is an educational game, emotionally, for children.

—user summary

Name: Ritter Trenk: Erbsenschiessen mit Thekla
Description:
In this game of skill from the Knights Trenk universe, players have to balance two green balls (peas) into the appropriate holes using four different cards of each color (red, blue, yellow, green). If you have met one of the people on the card with the peas (the balls holed), you get the card. Otherwise, the next player's turn. If you have all four cards of a color at the end, you have won.

—user summary

Name: Die Olchis: Rattenduell
Description:
In this speed game from the Olchi Universe, players must first place their rat on one of the three colored (yellow, blue, orange) garbage cans. Which garbage can needs to be filled is diced with a color cube. It is rolled in turn. The player to be thrown plays the role of an Olchi, who tries to put the lid on the diced bin in front of the rats. If the Olchi player is faster, he gets an Olchipunkt. If a rat player is faster, this gets an Olchipunkt. If a rat player places his rat on a wrong garbage bin, he must give an Olchipunkt. The player with the most Olchipoints has won.

—user summary
Families: Creatures: Die Olchis (designed by Erhard Dietl)

Name: Kneipenquiz: Brandneue Fragen
Description: 250 brand-new questions for Kneipenquiz.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters: Fracture of Biel-Tan Campaign Box
Description:
Set in the dark sci-fantasy world of Warhammer 40,000, Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters allows players to build teams of iconic characters and warriors to battle it out for supremacy using custom dice and cards. Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters uses the game system designed by Mike Elliott and Eric M. Lang for Dice Masters and is completely compatible with other games in the line. Four factions are available when the series first launches, and players can either build teams using a single faction or mix and match to create their own Dice Masters team.

The Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters: Fracture of Biel-Tan Campaign Box features iconic characters from the Daemons of Chaos and Ynnari like Skarbrand, The Masque of Slaanesh, The Yncarne, and Yvraine! With multiple versions of each, select the one that fits your team the best!

Name: Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters: Dark Angels – The First Team Pack
Description:
Part of a rumored second Warhammer 40K campaign box, with two accompanying team packs:

Fracture of Biel-Tan features iconic characters from the Daemons of Chaos and Ynnari like Skarbrand, The Masque of Slaanesh, The Yncarne, and Yvraine! The Dark Angels – The First Team Pack features iconic Dark Angels like Fallen Angel, Cypher and recognizable army-building pieces like the Deathwing Knight. The Blood Angels – Black Rage Team Pack features iconic Blood Angels like Commander Dante and can’t-be-missed units like the Death Company and Sanguinary Priests.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters: Blood Angels – Black Rage Team Pack
Description:
Part of a rumored second Warhammer 40K campaign box, with two accompanying team packs:

Fracture of Biel-Tan features iconic characters from the Daemons of Chaos and Ynnari like Skarbrand, The Masque of Slaanesh, The Yncarne, and Yvraine! The Dark Angels – The First Team Pack features iconic Dark Angels like Fallen Angel, Cypher and recognizable army-building pieces like the Deathwing Knight. The Blood Angels – Black Rage Team Pack features iconic Blood Angels like Commander Dante and can’t-be-missed units like the Death Company and Sanguinary Priests.

Name: Gryphon Delivery Service
Description:
Gryphon couriers have always been the backbone of trade in Dsyx. Fast, discreet, and formadible in the face of pirates and bandits. But Gnomish airships, Dwarven "Grease Tunnels" and the ever improving field of teleportation magic has left gryphon-run delivery services hustling for work. Coordinate your last few couriers on the most profitable run possible, contending with unpredictable winds, mischevious fairies, and coniving goblins, and maybe you won't have to close your doors.

Gryphon Delivery Service is a solitaire roll-and-write game where players attempt to move three characters -- gryphon couriers -- along a track from start to finish, while picking up and dropping off various items to turn a profit. Each space either yields an item, allows an item to be sold, or represents an encounter with one of the Dsyx world's various races that can offer players a windfall... or catastrophe. Instead of being sold outright, items can also be used instead to influence various markets, raising prices for (hopeful) future sales. Players must manage each of their characters, their special abilities, and their inventories well, because as soon as the first character reaches the end of the track, the game is over, and any items that were left undelivered represent lost opportunities to make precious gold.

The easy part is getting to the end of the game. The hard part is having anything to show for it. Succeed, and the courier service will live to see another day; fail, and hard-working gryphons will blame YOU for their unemployment.

—description from the publisher


Released in the July 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: Megacity Heist
Description:
Welcome to the city of Megacity. A prosperous city full of fun, laughter and, above all else peace. And, oh how we detest it so. We here at Nasty Malevolent and Evil Incorporate (N.M.E. INC.) are looking for a few up and coming villains to try their hand at taking over this Illustrious city. We will provide you with a hideout and a steady flow of expendable henchmen for you to work with. So come forth and create a little chaos and mayhem on your path to notoriety. Good luck out there and be on the look out for them pesky heroes.

Megacity is a worker management, make your own luck game where you play as a comic villain who is trying to take over Megacity. You will use your villain and your henchmen to pull heists, fight heroes and, attack other villains to rake in the loot and Villainy Points on your way to victory.

On a player's turn, they will receive a henchman and are able to acquire more up to their current level. They will then manage their hideout and/or acquire the upgrade "Tools of Villainy" cards to become a stronger villain. Finally, they will assign their henchmen and villain to go out and attack the city/other villains to bring in loot and Villainy Points(VP).

Attacks are done by rolling dice. The amount of dice a villain rolls is determined by the amount of henchmen and whether the villain is part of the attack. They roll against the city who have a number of dice they roll depending on its difficulty level. Sometimes heroes will appear and they only roll against the villain not the henchmen. A player can attack another villain's hideout to which the defender rolls an amount of dice equal to their defense.

When a villain reaches 25 VP, every other villain takes one more turn to get to 25 VP. If no one else does, the villain that did wins. If multiple villains do, they have a villain on villain fight to determine the big boss of Megacity.

-description from designer

Name: Ratingen 10
Description:
"Ratingen 10" is a tactical sorting game. Every player gets ten random cards and places them in a random order face up in front of him. The goal of the game is to form a row from 1-10 or from 10-1. To achieve this goal, you change the place of two cards in your row or you change one of your cards with one of the other players. In the end, only who pays attention very well, can win the game.

The game is published on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of the "Ratinger Spieletage".

-description from designer

Name: Black Rose Wars: Armageddon Promo Card
Description:
Promotional card that was an add-on during the 2018 Man vs Meeple Kickstarter Campaign.

Inflict 4 damage to all targets in play.  You suffer 2 damage from the Black Rose.

-or-

Choose 3 rooms (except Black Rose and Throne Room) send the mages back to their cells.  Destroy the rooms and gain 4. Nobody takes the room tokens for the instability.

Name: Charafe
Description:
Family card game from 2 to 12 players (or more in team).
Charafe, has a Syllabics mechanic, and is a word-guessing game.

On a turn, the player draws 2 cards from the common deck and assembles the first part of the animal name on one card with the last part of the animal in the other card. He asks their teammates to find the alternate name of the fantastic animal he just created by reading the second part constituted name. Player who find the right name (with right article - in french, it matters).

Once the deck is depleted, the player owning most of cards is the winner.

There's some variant rules in the booklet to increase game length, difficulty, and number of players.

-description from publisher

Name: Europa Base Alpha
Description:
There is no Cold War that is more chilling or isolated than on the untouched surface of Jupiter's moon, Europa. The nations have broken apart and are now in a race to get defenses established on Europa before it is too late. Will you take control of Europa with the largest network of installations, or will you be left in lunar dust?

In Europa Base Alpha, players compete to build the grandest network of moon bases on Europa made up of missile silos, communication towers, global command centers, personnel bunkers, and intergalactic transports. Cards and dice are used to help you build your bases as well as hinder other players. Bases need certain icons rolled, and cards can be played to aid in getting those icons or to hinder an opponent by requiring more icons, having them roll fewer dice, etc.

The player with the most points earned from built moon bases will take control of Europa and win!

Europa Base Alpha includes an "Invaders" expansion for more variability!

Name: BallTriX
Description:
BallTriX, is a new cool game to share good times with family and friends.

The game is quite similar to Abalone. But instead of pushing your opponent's marble out of the board, you try to push the red marble out of the board with your own marbles. When this happens, you or your team wins the game.
It can be played individually (2-3 players) or in teams (2-2 or 3-3). 
With its modern and elegant design, it is a beautiful decorative object that will integrate perfectly in your living room, on a coffee table, a piece of furniture or a shelf of your library.

Name: ¡Adiós Calavera!: The Three Player Expansion – ¡Hasta Nunca!
Description:
This expansion adds the 2 new characters from the original ¡Hasta Nunca! expansion for the third player. Their abilities can only be used once during the game.

Gabriel - The Freeloader: When calculating the movement points for him count pieces of the opponent double.

Lacinia - The Social One: She determines her movement points according to the normal ability. After she has moved, the player may move another one of their pieces with the same number of movement points. Any special abilities of the second piece may not be used.

-description from publisher

Name: Herstoricas Pioneras
Description:
Herstoricas Pioneras is game dedicated to historical female figures in Spain. The game contains 60 cards depicting 30 different female pioneers (each card is duplicated). With them, you can play 3 different games: a memory game, a speed game, and a guessing game.
Each card is illustrated by a different female artist from the Autoras de Comic collective.

—user summary

Name: Launch the Dragonslayer!
Description:
In this medium-weight dexterity campaign microgame, launch an adventuring hero (who only superficially resembles a paperclip) from a stack of dice to hit specific targets representing feats of accuracy, athleticism, and daring. Inspired by retro adventure video games, Launch the Dragonslayer! will challenge your hero to brave ever-changing wilds, ration limited resources, leverage unique class abilities, and withstand the temptation of cool cheat codes, all in a noble quest to find and slay a monstrous dragon!

Gameplay progresses through a cycle of turns, which involve rolling for randomized time- and region-dependent encounters, deciding to either travel or recover resources, and moving Time forward one unit. If an encounter occurs, then a system of hit values and encounter effects determines the encounter's ebb and flow. Play is meant to be divided into several sessions, with the general progress of each turn saved between plays. The game ends when your hero resolves the Dragon encounter to slay their sworn foe.

At the beginning of the game, players can choose one of six classes for their hero, each of which has a unique ability that encourages a different style of play. Four stats act as resources that are expended to withstand damage, increase the power of a launch's effect, make it easier to hit a target, or level up to increase your hero's maximum stat amount.

As the hero draws closer to their goal, they will face different effects in each region they visit, challenging you to optimize your hero's path and assess the rewards of various risks. But all the careful planning in the world will only take you so far. In the end, what will make or break your hero's future is how well you can Launch the Dragonslayer!

—description from the designer

Name: My Friends Tigger & Pooh: 5 in einer Reihe
Description: In this children's game from the Winnie the Pooh universe, players must pull wooden tiles trying to collect a figure in five different sizes. The first player who has a series of figures in all 5 sizes wins the game.

Name: Space Race Game
Description:
A simple spin and move race to the moon where players choose a spaceship cardboard marker and in turns spin the spinner to move. Players follow special directions along the raceway that may help or hinder their travels. first to the moon is the winner.

A Warren Built game from the late 1950s to 1960s that came in a number of sized versions. The smaller version has the playing board separating and one section of the board is turned around and interlocked into the other section to extend the game board length.

—user summary

Name: Ricardo Corazón de León: Nuevos personajes
Description:
War advances and, meanwhile, conspiracies and alliances play their role behind the scenes. More and more allies want to join the fight on the side of Ricardo or Juan. This promotional box contains 5 new Characters with new skills!

-Will Scarlet: Whenever you are going to earn prestige points, earn 1 additional prestige point.

-Wandering Knight: At the beginning of the purchase phase, draw 2 random cards. Stay with 1 and give the other to any player of the opposite faction.

-Nun Maria: At the end of each round, if you do not have cards in your hand, draw 3 cards randomly.

-Ecclesiastic: After contributing to the crusade you can draw 1 faction card. You can keep this card or play it, face up, for the results of the crusade.

-Steward: At the start of the purchase phase, draw 2 random cards from the supply deck. Stay with 1 and give another to any player of the opposite faction.

Name: 5150: Back Alleys, Bright Lights
Description:
What: A stand alone 5150 RPG that can be played with our other 5150 titles.
Scale: 1 figure equals 1 man.
Your Role: Players try to gain Fame and Fortune while adventuring in New Hope City's dangerous Little Hisha.
Playability: Designed for solo, same side and head to head play.

Back Alleys Bright Lights takes you deep into New Hope City - specifically the area known as Little Hisha. It's our first 5150 stand alone supplement that goes into greater detail, allowing you to play unique, one of a kind adventures, while you create your Story.

Inside you’ll find:

Five two-sided color tiles with 40 buildings with over 100 areas to explore.
An easy to use combat system that enhances, not inhibits, your games.
An easy to use Character Interaction system that brings each Non-Player Character to life as you wheel and deal with them.
Interact with or play as one of 13 different Races and 17 different Professions.
Rules for Psy - you call it Psionics, we call it Psy.
A minimal bookkeeping Campaign System that gives meaning to every game as the results of one will affect the outcome of the next.
A counter sheet of 40 different characters representing 10 different Aliens.
All this and much more...

Back Alleys Bright Lights can be played with 5150 Urban Renewal, New Hope City PI, Fringe Space and even Future Tales.

Check out NHC PI, a supplement for use with 5150 Back Alleys Bright Lights. "NHC PI, when the Police just won't do!"

-description from publisher's website

Name: Alien vs Predator: Hot Landing Zone
Description:
Alien vs Predator: Hot Landing Zone (AvP:HLZ) is an expansion to Alien vs Predator: The Hunt Begins (AvP:THB) tactical board game. In this expansion, rules for new Models are being introduced for each Faction! The AvP:HLZ expansion allows for the different Forces to do battle on limited visibility on the planet’s dense surface Jungles.

Each Model presents new tactical opportunities or a more advanced foe your Force needs to overcome, and they can be added to your existing AvP:THB Force or your used according to the Advanced Rules’ Custom Forces.

The Transport and Harass mechanic is introduced, in the form of a Dropship’s pilots taking part in the struggle for survival. The Human faction uses the Dropship to rapidly relocate their forces, while the Alien and Predator Factions try to make it too Hot a Landing Zone and cancel the Airlift operations.

AvP:HLZ presents additional rules, where you get to play a Free for All scenario of up to six players. Additional gaming boxes will be needed for this purpose, and use of add-on packs and Advanced Game Rules is highly recommended.

Whether you play using the Basic Rules or the Advanced Rules of the AvP:THB rulebook, this expansion allows you to expand your board game with the inclusion of Jungle Tile rules and other components, allowing for new and exciting Squads to join the fray. The use of Advanced Rules is enhanced as well, through additions to all Strategy and Event Cards, to either be added into the respective Decks, or replace cards from the basic set.

Core Set of Alien Versus Predator: The Hunt Begins in required to play.

Name: Monopoly: Unite Students Edition
Description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

From the rear of the box:
Welcome to the Unite Students edition of Monopoly. This game commemorates the first anniversary of the launch of Home for Success.
At Unite Students we want to create a home for our students, somehwere they feel comfortable to be themselves and have a sense of belonging, in an environment that helps then achieve success - whatever this might mean for them. And we also want to create this for our employees as well.
We're really proud of where we've come from and this game celebrates the different properties we've opened over the years, our people and our processes. Caring, uniting leading and ultimately deliversing is what has made us successful - ad will continue to do so in the future. And an important part of this is having the opportunity to interact with each other and have fun - something we hope this game will help enable.
Tour Unite Students for the hottest properties: sites, values and offices are all up for grabs.
Invest in flats and blocks, then watch the rent come pouring in!
make deals with other players and look out for bargains at auction, there are many ways to get what you want.
Stay sharp - because there's only room at the top for one. For everyone else, there's bankruptcy.
Trade your way to success - you can own it all!

PROPERTIES
BROWN
Jennens Court, Birmingham 2014 / Callice Court, Coventry 2007
LIGHT BLUE
Moonraker Point, London 2012 / Kendrick Hall, Reading 2011 / Greetham St. Portsmouth 2016
PINK
Riverside Point, Nottingham 2006 / The Holt, Loughbrough 2004 / Filbert Village, Leicester 2007
ORANGE 
Parkway Gate, Manchester 2008 / Grand Central, Liverpool 2003 / Saw Mill, Huddersfield 2014
RED 
The Forge, Sheffield 2005 / Sky Plaza, Leeds 2009 / Manor Back, Newcastle 2010
YELLOW 
Exeter Trust House, Exeter 2009 / Central Point, Plymouth 2002 / Purebeck House, Bournemouth 2005
GREEN 
The Old Fire Station, Aberdeen 2001 / Kelvin Court, Glasgow 2012 / Chalmers St., Edinburgh 2009
DARK BLUE 
Unite House, Bristol 2001 / Waterside Court, Bath 2004
STATIONS
We Care / we Lead / We Unite / We Deliver
UTILITIES
The Core / Swan House
TAXES
Property Tax / Student Loan
COMMUNITY CHEST / CHANCE
Community Chest / Chance

Name: Spider-Man Into the Spider-Verse Prowler Attack 3-D Game
Description:
It's a race across the 3-D gameboard to become the hero of the Spider-Verse! The excitement builds as Miles Morales and his friends are under attack. Choose to play as a favorite Spider-Man character: Miles Morales, Spider-Gwen, Spider-Man Noir, or Spider-Man. In order to save the city, players can power up with the Spider Symbol. But watch out for the Prowler -- he can attack with his rolling die from the top of a skyscraper. Be the first hero to capture the Prowler to win! Game includes Prowler action figure.

Includes 3-D gameboard, 4 Spider-Verse character pawns, 12 Spider-Verse tokens, 2 web walls, spider symbol token, 12-sided die, 6-sided die, Prowler figure, 4 pawn stands, and instructions.

Name: Hedbanz: Pokemon X Y
Description:
The game that's all about using your head! Discover the quick question game of 'Who am I?' featuring favorite Pokémon characters.

Play the game where you never know which character you are until you start asking questions! Are you Pikachu, Bulbasaur, or maybe Squirtle?

Be the first player to guess who you are and win! Pokemon Hedbanz—where everybody knows but you!

—description from the publisher

Name: Sunrise Sardines
Description:
There are 3 cards in the middle of the table that make up the ocean and that have 3 separate actions you can take. Each player has a boat that they move to the selected action they want to do on their turn. If both players take the same action whomever arrived at that spot second gets a weaker action they can take. Also, you may not take the same action twice in a row.

Actions you can take:

Trade - You may trade with the available cards that are in the market or draw one card from the deck. The amount of cards you may trade are equal to the number on the card, (which moves up and down during the game like a mini stock market) If you are the second boat to arrive on this spot you can trade one less card.

Fish - You may draw cards equal to the number on your fisherman card that you have leveled up to. If you are the second boat to arrive you draw one less card from the deck.

Sell - If you move your boat to this space the seagull switches to the player it is currently not with. (Seagull forces you to pay one extra when selling) 
On this space you may sell to the fancy man. On his card is a row of numbers that slowly grows each time he's sold to and is also the amount you must sell to him. There is a small 5 card deck next to him with the top card revealed that shows what sardine can the fancy man is wanting to be sold. When a fancy man sale is made you raise the trade market number up one, your fisherman up one, and the fancy man up one on their respective trackers. After selling to the fancy man you flip over the sardine can to show it has been sold to you and you gain points based on how many you acquire by the end of the game.

During the game you are collecting sets of cans or a variety pack which is all 5 brands of cans. These cans can be sold, and count as points. Once the fancy man has been sold 5 cans the game ends and the player who did not trigger the end game gets one last turn.

Player with the most points wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Gwiezdny wyścig
Description:
A fun and simple family board game. Each player gets two secret missions to transport goods. These missions correspond to two specific spaceships on the board. The goals are achieved by wisely using the set of actions available.

In his turn, a player plays one of his Action card and does the action described on the card. These actions consist of moving one or more spaces on the board, closer to planet (Card+), further from planet (cards-) or by switching two spaces(Switch cards).

A round can end either when a spaceship reaches the planet or when all players have played all their Action cards.

Each player then reveals his two Mission cards and scores the number of points corresponding to the spaceships on each of his Mission cards.

This reimplemtation of J'ai mon voyage introduces two variants to the game: family and advanced. Family variant does not use more complicated “Swap”, “Copy” and “Reverse” cards. Advanced variant allows players to use special abilities of the planets and limits their hands at the beginning of the mission, to make game more challenging.

Name: It's Blunderful
Description:
It’s Blunderful is a party game where you bet on how others would respond to awkward situations. It’s easy to learn you’ll be having fun in a matter of 30 seconds. With dynamic conversations and inspired storytelling, you’ll be surprised at the things you learn about your friends, family and yourself.

The game has fun, non-offensive content that’s relatable to adults so you can play with all of your adult friends and family. The strategic betting component raises the stakes for competitive players and keeps all players involved in every turn. Each player has their own betting scorecard used to place their bets. Read the Blunderful card and secretly choose how you would react. Other players place their bets on how they believe you would react. Everyone reveals their answers. Players who guessed the correct answer gain the points they wagered, but those who guessed incorrectly lose the number of points they wagered. The first person to reach 100 points wins.

Enjoy the camaraderie, the laughter and the stories that arise about the awkward moments – we’ve all been there.

Name: Hilal Hattı
Description:
Hilal HattÄ± (Crescent Line) is a strategy game loosely based on the Ottoman History. In an alternate timeline, the Ottoman Empire is in turmoil and the local lords (players) have to reconquer lost land and establish control over the empire. For this they have to expand, raise their cultural level and recruit new armies that can adapt to geography and their enemies.

Hilal HattÄ± is a unit and resource management strategy game that focuses on a smart but easy battle management system and tactics. Players will build and conquer while gaining “historic” textbook titles that will carry them to the victory.

—description from the designer

Name: Crooked Kingdom
Description:
In Crooked Kingdom, you are one out of six different characters trying to get ahead in a kingdom where everybody lies. But in order to advance and beat your friends you must use trickery and deceit to convince them that you are something else so that you can gain all the riches and win the game!

You can not let everyone get away with lying right to your face. During the game, you will have a chance to judge the other players when you become the Judge. You will have the power to challenge their claims and reap the sweet, sweet reward as they curl up in shame and the other players marvel at your ability to spot the lies (unless, of course, you are wrong and have to pay the penalty).

The first person to get enough points will win the game, it's up to you how to play. Will you be honest and take it slow and let the others be caught by the Judge or will you keep up the poker face while you lie through your teeth? Do you have what it takes to spot the liars of the group or will you be stuck paying coin after coin when you challenge someone who told the truth?

—description from the designer

Name: Crypt: The Book of Variants
Description:
Crypt The Book of Variants is an expansion to the board game Crypt, featuring a rulebook with three new game modes and a set of game tiles. *A copy of Crypt is needed to play the game*

Game Modes:
1. Cursed Treasure adds a new dimension to the game, penalizing the player who takes the most 3 and 4 value cards.

2. Clash of Houses has teams of two fight over the most valuable treasure. Thee mode supports 6-8 players. *Requires two copies of Crypt*

3. Conspiring Twins is a co-operative mode where players work together to get the most valuable treasurer from the ghosts of their parents.

-description from designer

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Union and Disillusion: Mythos Pack
Description:
Union and Disillusion is the fourth Mythos Pack in The Circle Undone cycle for Arkham Horror: The Card Game.

After your brush with the Silver Twilight Lodge in For the Greater Good, you journey to the banks of the Miskatonic River in search of the four souls who went missing from one of the Lodge’s events. Between two of the bridges that span the river, there stands the Unvisited Isle. The foggy shores are barren and unwelcoming, and as you row closer, you try to remain silent, as if to keep the river itself from noticing. Not a soul greets you as you draw closer to the island, save for the judging gaze of ghostly birds that observe you from the trees. In the distance, a pillar of spectral energy is rising into the clouds, a vortex of otherworldly mist spiraling about it.

As you explore the island, you will find braziers scattered at various locations, that you can either light or douse with the new Circle action ability. Lighting these braziers may help push back the heavy mist, allowing you to further explore the island, but it may also be the key step in completing the ritual that has already begun. How far can you push Arkham to the brink of chaos without surrendering the city to the dark forces battling for control of it?
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Game: Arkham Horror TCG – The Circle Undone
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Curse of the Crimson Throne Adventure Path
Description:
The King is Dead, Long Live the Queen!

Korvosa is cursed that none of its monarchs shall ever die of old age or produce an heir. The metropolis teeters on the edge of anarchy. It needs heroes that can face down crime lords, rioting mobs, insane cultists, virulent plague, undead hordes, scheming devils, corrupt nobles, barbarian chieftains, and ancient and forgotten evils that seek to dominate and sacrifice the city.

This expansion to the popular cooperative Pathfinder Adventure Card Game pits 1 to 6 players against monsters, perils, and traps as you save the city of Korvosa from threats both ancient and new. Choose your character; build a deck of unique equipment, magic, and allies; and explore lethal locations as you journey through an exciting fantasy tale. As your adventures continue, your characters will add remarkable gear and breathtaking magic to their decks as they gain incredible powers, all of which they'll need to challenge more and more powerful threats.

This set includes the storybook and cards for the Curse of the Crimson Throne Adventure Path. It requires the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game Core Set and expands the maximum number of players to 6 for that set.

The Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Curse of the Crimson Throne Adventure Path includes:


    550 cards featuring a wide array of powerful weapons, magical spells, protective armors, versatile items, helpful allies, harrowing blessings, devoted supporters, and a base to help you face a host of vicious monsters, dangerous barriers, vile scourges, and perilous wildcards
    4 character pawns representing Hakon the skald, Kess the brawler, Quinn the investigator, and Varian the wizard
    1 48-page storybook featuring all 6 chapters of The Curse of the Crimson Throne Adventure Path
Families: Series: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game (Paizo Publishing)

Name: Sangha-Do
Description:
In this game you play together, not against each other. Everyone wins together or everyone loses!

The basic idea of the game is that every person strives for happiness and satisfaction in their own way. On this path, you have to overcome fundamental difficulties in life, depicted in the cards and rules of the game. Some cards show things that people suffer from. Other cards show ways to help resolve these ailments. But our lifetime is limited. At some point, the last hour will come! Do we go with a heart full or with sorrow that could not be resolved?

Unfortunately, help is not always readily available, not everything is visible. Unforeseen events change the situation in a flash, and without mutual support, we are lost...

The game is won when all players are freed of their Suffering cards before they have to discard the last Vitality card.

—description from the publisher (translated)


In diesem Spiel spielt man gemeinsam, nicht gegeneinander. Es gewinnen alle zusammen oder alle verlieren.

Der Grundgedanke des Spiels ist dabei, dass jeder Mensch auf seine Weise im Leben nach Glück und Zufriedenheit strebt. Zu überwinden sind auf diesem Weg grundlegende Schwierigkeiten des Lebens, abgebildet in den Karten und Regeln des Spiels. Einige Karten zeigen Dinge, an denen Menschen leiden. Andere Karten zeigen Möglichkeiten der Hilfe, um diese Leiden aufzulösen. Doch unsere Lebenszeit ist begrenzt. Irgendwann schlägt die letzte Stunde! Gehen wir mit einem erfüllten Herzen oder voller Leid, das sich nicht auflösen ließ?

Hilfe ist leider nicht immer passend zur Hand, nicht alles ist sichtbar, unvorhergesehene Ereignisse verändern die Lage blitzartig und ohne gegenseitige Unterstützung sind wir verloren...

Das Spiel ist gewonnen, wenn alle Spieler/innen von ihren Karten des Leidens befreit wurden, bevor sie die letzte Karte Lebenskraft abgeben müssen.

—description from the publisher

Name: Indrago!
Description:
Indrago means "Inside the Dragon".

In order to win this 2-players-strategy, the player must place his/her Knight (chip) in the middle of the enemy Dragon.
Each player has 1 Dragon and 6 Knights of gold or silver color. Their strength depends on the color they stand (the game board is a tricolor "Island", surrounded by "water"). The Dragons can carry own Knights on their backs and capture enemy Knights.

—description from the designer

Name: Robot Wars: Coding Strategy Game
Description:
The Concept
   In the game, players will be commanding their robots using the cards given. The game starts with Instruction cards where we introduce basic commands in simple code. Slowly game moves to resource cards on which bigger code with generic syntax is written. Robots will be executing these codes sequentially just in the way computers execute programs. The cards are written in Java but readable as simple English.

Anyone who can read and understand English can easily read and follow these codes, thus making it easy for kids and adults to learn programming. There are complicated code cards which will be used in strategy level, which are explained well in the rule book.

The Story 
   C.E.L.E.B (Command Executing Laser Equipped Bot) was developed by S.A.I.L (Secret Artificial Intelligence Lab) for military for war purposes. As the name says he can execute his human partner's commands and shoot enemies with the laser from his chest.

As a part of S.A.I.L's training program to choose the Commanding Officers for the bots, players are being tested against their logic and strategy in the artificial war zone. Shoot Cards will be distributed equally to all the players. First player starts the game by picking up the top card of Instructions deck and moves his robot according to the command on his Instruction card. If he gets to move to a new grid on the board using this card, he can collect the top card of Resources deck. When it is first players turn again he can choose between playing his resource and picking up a new instruction. As the game goes on, you will collect more resources and strategize your game better. As the robot moves on war zone it will collect important resource codes for it's partner which will help him strategize in the war. The player who reaches the middle of war zone first will be promoted as Commanding Officer. But you need to shoot at least one enemy robot before getting there.

Components
  The game box contains

- 1 Game board (AKA) War zone
    - A deck of Instruction Cards(codes)
    - A deck of Resource Cards
    - A deck of Shoot Cards
    - A rule book
    - 4 C.E.L.E.B game markers

Name: Dominus
Description:
Dominus is a tile-laying game where players compete to build the most prestigious medieval monastery. The game features very simple rules, lots of interaction between players (in the form of a shared resource market) and clever tile-laying where players try to match the sides of the tile they are building with the sides of previously built tiles (dominoes style) in order to maximize their score and get access to extra resources. DOMINVS is a fast-paced tile-laying game where a clever placement of your workers on the market will not only grant you access to more resources but may occasionally help you win coins when other players harvest, thus saving you from spending one of your turns harvesting. The market manipulation provides a lot of interaction between players, but not the destructive type of interaction because, even when somebody messes with your plans, new possibilities open in the market for you.

On their turn, the player places one resource tile together with one of their workers into the market (formed by a 3x3 grid of resource tiles). The tile is either placed on the leftmost space of a row or in the topmost space of a column, thus pushing out one other resource tile from the market that the player then collects. If there is a worker on the expelled tile, it's owner recovers it and gains a Prestige Point. Then the player activates the row or the column of the market where the tile and the worker were placed (each resource tile specifies if activates a column or a row).
When activating a row or a column, the player performs one of two possible actions: harvest or build:

The end game is triggered when a player reaches 50 Prestige points. Then, a final round is played and the player with most Prestige Points wins the game.

During playtest, 4 player games would take no longer than 30 minutes, making DOMINVS a fast playing game, with an interesting engine building mechanism integrated, with simple rules but with lots of interesting decisions each turn.

DOMINVS was also designed from the beginning with an integrated and fully functional solo variant.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bali: Village of Tani
Description:
Bali: Village of Tani is the second major expansion for Bali and introduces a few new aspects to the game.

There are some extra playing cards for the building of the Village of Tani. The village board consists of four different parts.

In Phase 2, each player has a new action available during their turn: Build a hut.

This action can be performed instead of the regular action Play cards. You place a farmer card from your hand onto the discard pile to build a hut in the corresponding area on the village board. Then place 1, 2 or 3 sacrifice cards of your choice from your hand back into the supply to determine on which field in that area you can place your hut. After placing your hut, you immediately receive the bonus of that area: Ganesha figure, stones, or a banana plantation tiles for scoring bonus points.

Additionally, there will be a wooden "Ganesha meeple" which delivers more points when scoring Priests.

Finally, extra victory point tokens helps make score-keeping a little easier.

Important: If a player still has any unbuilt huts at the end of the game then that player does not participate in the end scoring and automatically loses the game. So, you must build all the huts you received at the start of the game.

-description from publisher

Name: TOGO: Dawn of the Dreadnoughts – Naval Battles of the Russo-Japanese War
Description:
TOGO is a tactical naval game of the 1904-05 battles of the Russo-Japanese War. TOGO is a reworked version of Tsushima that appeared in S&T 130. Changes include the new 1904 ships and scenarios, new torpedo hit table, improved and more accurate Ship Logs/Roster sheets and far superior graphics.

TOGO is a battleship game. TOGO was conceived as a game that allows for a realistic yet playable surface combat game for this period. The concept was to design a big game that would give one the sense of the grandeur and scope of one of the largest series of surface engagements in the modern era and yet not load you the player down with needless detail. Certain liberties and abstractions were taken to achieve the overall goal.

Name: Taigo
Description:
INTRODUCTION

Taigo (taiji + go, the Japanese word for “five”) is a tile-laying game in which both players use the same unique type tile, which has both of their colours, with the goal of creating a 5-in-a-row of their colour. Also the players must fill the ‘holes’ that they will eventually create with cones of either colour. But if the game lasts long enough, your cone supply may run out and you will be forced to use your opponent’s colour!

MATERIAL

- 40 tiles composed of two conjoined hexes of different colours (Dark and Light).
- 10 cones of each colour (20 in total).
- Carrying case.

GAMEPLAY OVERVIEW (please refer to official rulebook)

Starting with Dark, players alternate turns placing a tile adjacent to at least one tile already played, aligned with an imaginary hexagonal grid. Colours don’t need to match.

If your placement creates a single-hex hole, you must fill that hole with a cone of either color from the supply, even if it helps your opponent more than you. Only if the supply is empty do you skip this step.

If, at the end of your turn, there is a straight line of 5 or more circles and/or cones of your colour, you win.

-description from publisher

Name: TINfluence
Description:
Humanity has set out for the stars and settled on different planets. It is now your time to spread influence on the new colonies and undermine your opponent.

TINfluence is a two player game where you will exert influence on planets by playing action to move or add influence tokens.

Each turn, each player will draft actions that are then played out. These actions can add or move influence tokens or can challenge the other player for influence over a planet. The player that has the most influence on a planet gains Victory Points.

The player with the most victory point at the end of the game wins.

-description from designer

Name: Amulet
Description:
The old king has no heirs to the throne, and has decreed that he will pass his crown to the one who has acquired the greatest amount of mystical power (represented in pentacles) between:


     the Knight/Dame who kills the last dragons, and 
     the Knight/Dame who kills the greatest number of dragons.


 
Pentacles are awarded in specific amounts to players according to their choices, when they simultaneously choose, without knowing the other player's choice, to form or not to form alliances upon encountering each other along the game path.
 Pentacle color combinations of 15 pentacles, selected from 9 different colors, are offered to obtain 1 of 3 Amulets of different capabilities to kill the dragons, according to the pentacle combinations offered.
 In the meantime, the players must prevent the dragons from destroying any of the towns in the 9 shires, as a 13th attack on any town renders it destroyed, which forfeits the game to the dragons.

Each time the dice are thrown by any player to advance on the game path in the course of regular play, the dice score numbers also indicate which of the 9 numbered shires has its towns attacked by the dragons, and any undefended towns in those shires receive a damage disc, which must not accumulate to 13 for any town.

So, from the outset, an intense race begins to meet a rapid unrelenting onslaught of attacks by the dragons, which attack somewhere on every throw of the dice. A town (18 towns total) can receive a defender when landed on in the course of regular play, which prevents any further damage to that town. A player is knighted when he/she becomes defender of both of the 2 towns in a shire. Once Knighted the play becomes eligible to fight the dragons with an Amulet upon obtaining one.

The object for the players is to kill the 6 dragons in a contest against each other according to the above mentioned criteria with the use of the 3 Amulet types (a player can only possess 1 Amulet at a time), but are quickly drawn into a perilous concerted drive to preclude the dragons from thwarting their opportunity with a 13th attack on an undefended town.

In a dragon fight each of the 3 Amulet types ensures the defeat of any one of 4 of the 6 dragons, so each of the 3 Amulet types ensures the defeat of a different set of 4 of the 6 dragons. Therefore, an Amulet gives the player a 2 to 1 advantage over the dragon, which could kill the player if it is not one of the 4 listed on the Amulet. Players can prevent being killed if they have an escape card.

Amulet features a fascinating paradox where players are compelled to cooperate and form alliances to set up an end game where they can seek to defeat each other. Failure to do so, could brings the game swiftly to and end with victory going to the dragons.

—description from the designer

Name: Agricola: Corbarius Deck
Description:
The Corbarius Deck (letter C deck) consists of the 120 cards present in this box: 60 new minor improvements and 60 new occupations that you can play on their own, or combine with other decks.
These 120 cards were the ones used in 2020 for officially sanctioned tournaments.

12 more cards with the deck letter C have been published in the 5/6 player expansion.

Some of those C cards had been previously released in the Miniature expansions from WizKidz. It has been communicated from the beginning that those cards would reappear later. If things needed to get fixed between the Miniature release and the regular release, Lookout Games has fixed them.

Name: Cytosis: Epigenetic Modification  Cards Promo
Description:
This promo consists of asymmetric starting cards. It was included in the Kickstarter version of Cytosis and now its available as a promo for other editions in some languages.

Each Epigenetic Modification Card gives a player a unique ability that they may use throughout the game.

It is advised not to use the Epigenetic Modification Cards until players have played Cytosis and are already familiar with the game. The Epigenetic Modification Cards may be used with the Base Game of Cytosis or combined with the Virus Expansion.

—user summary

Name: Cytosis: Promo Pack
Description: This promo pack includes some new goals, events and 2 cards that can be used to modify the game board for new spaces to place workers.

Name: Cytosis: Microscope Promo Card
Description:
This promo available for backers of The Dice Tower Kickstarter 2019.

During another player’s turn, mimic the current action taken by that player if able. Then exhaust this card by flipping it face down.
When any player takes the first player marker from the previous owner, pass this card to the player in last position and refresh this card.

Name: Popeye: Schlagkräftig!
Description:
Striking! A small golf ball and a wide distant target .. No problem for Popeye. Brutus will do everything to stop him and Olivia will stand by her Popeye. Anything is possible at this golf tournament!

A entertaining quick game with coasters. Fun for everyone!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Game play: If there is no own Popeye on the board, one is placed on the tee-off field. The active player rolls with both dice.  Each rolled double (2x equal number) now causes the checkered flag to be moved. The rolled number shows where (new target field).

The active player always rolls again after a double. Both rolled results can be used for the movement of figures. At least 1 movement has to be done on a player’s turn. A figure movement takes place with your own Popeye, Olivia, or Brutus.

The rolled numbers 1 to 6 show the possible range of movement on the board. The player will always have 3 possible results after rolling both dice.

Popeye (-balls) are immediately holed when 1 Popeye moves to the checkered flag field with the last step of his current movement (the target field of a movement).

Oliva helps / Repositions Popeye: The coaster on which the Oliva token is currently lying is relevant here. Land a Popeye as the target field of a movement on a free field of this coaster (no matter where, 1 out of 9 possible fields), the player can reposition this Popeye on any field of this coaster.

Brutus prevents / Blocking Popeye(s): The coaster on which the Brutus token is currently lying or being moved is relevant here. All the Popeyes lying there or those, which should be moved on this coaster, cannot move until Brutus is moved down from this coaster again.

Once a player has holed his 3 Popeyes at the end of a full round, that player wins the game.

-description from designer

    


Schlagkraftig! Ein kleiner Golfball und ein weit entferntes Ziel .. Kein Problem fur Popeye. Brutus wird alles tun, um ihn 
aufzuhalten und Olivia wird ihrem Popeye zur Seite stehen. Bei diesem Golfturnier ist alles moglich!

Ein kurzweiliges schnelles Spiel mit Spieldeckeln. Spaß für jedermann!

—description from the publisher (German)

Spielablauf: Befindet sich kein eigener Popeye auf dem Plan, wird einer auf das Abschlagsfeld platziert. Der aktive Spieler würfelt mit beiden Würfeln.
Jeder jetzt erwürfelte Pasch (2x gleiche Zahl) führt dazu, dass die Zielflagge wandert. Die erwürfelte Zahl zeigt wohin (neues Zielfeld). Der aktive Spieler würfelt nach einem Pasch immer erneut.
Beide erwürfelte Ergebnisse können für die Bewegung von Figuren genutzt werden. Mindestens 1 Bewegung muss pro Runde vom Spieler ausgeführt werden. Eine Figuren-Bewegung erfolgt mit dem eigenen Popeye, Oliva oder Brutus. Die erwürfelten Zahlen 1 bis 6 zeigen dabei die möglichen Bewegungsweiten auf dem Spielplan. Dem Spieler stehen nach dem Würfeln beider Würfel immer 3 mögliche Ergebnisse zur Verfügung.
Popeye (-Bälle) werden sofort eingelocht (kommen dann aus dem Spiel), wenn 1 Popeye als Zielfeld einer Bewegung auf das Feld mit der Zielflagge kommt.
Oliva hilft / Neu-Positionierung von Popeye: Der Deckel, auf dem der Oliva-Marker gerade liegt, ist hier relevant. Landet ein Popeye als Zielfeld einer Bewegung auf ein freies Feld dieses Deckels (egal wo, 1 von 9 möglichen Feldern), kann der Spieler diesen Popeye auf ein beliebiges Feld dieses Deckels neu positionieren. 
Brutus behindert / Blockieren von Popeye(s): Der Deckel, auf dem der Brutus-Marker gerade liegt oder gezogen wird, ist hier relevant. Alle dort liegenden Popeyes oder welche, die auf diesen Deckel gezogen werden sollen, können sich nicht bewegen, bis Brutus von diesem Deckel wieder runtergezogen wird.
Sobald ein Spieler am Ende einer kompletten Runde seine 3 Popeyes eingelocht hat, gewinnt dieser Spieler das Spiel.

Name: Hägar: Land in Sicht!
Description:
Land in sight! Hägar the Horrible & wavering ships in search of the treasure islands. The way is the goal and the way is not so easy. Roll and navigate your way through the oceans and find the hidden treasures first of all!

A entertaining quick game with coasters. Fun for everyone!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Game play: At the beginning of the player’s turn, the player navigates over the map (board) and tries to get a good navigation point to find good treasures.

The active player initially rolls both dice and then optionally has another roll with one or both dice. After that, counts the result. He now hit exactly 1 field of the board through the specified navigation lines (intersection).

If a player hits an island field directly or indirectly (across a neighbored sea field), all treasure tokens lying on this island can be revealed immediately. The player now has the chance to win the treasures of this island. With a direct hit the player has up to 3 rolls, with an indirect hit (across neighbored sea field) only 1 roll with the dice.

For the winning of treasure tokens of islands being hit (directly or indirectly) the following applies:

Number tokens: If a dice shows the number of a certain number token, the treasure is discovered and can be picked up by the player.

Sven Glückspilz or Hägar tokens: A double (2x same number, no matter which one) wins one of these outlying tokens.

Lucky-7 (sum): A dice combination with the sum = 7 (1/6 or 2/5 or 3/4) can also be used as a wild card. The player can choose any outlying token of the island.

The game ends immediately, once all number tokens (total of 6 pieces) are discovered. The player with the fewest victory points in total loses the game. In case of a tie, several lose.

Each won number token counts victory points based on its numerical value. In addition there are (for one player) double victory points for a treasure token on the x2 field.

For the Hägar token, the number of all won number tokens count as additional victory points for the player (in addition to the normal number values).

For each Sven Glückspilz token the player rolls both dice exactly once. The difference between the two results (higher minus smaller number) shows the victory points achieved for this. The player gets nothing with a rolled double.


    


Land in Sicht! Hägar der Schreckliche & schwankende 
Schiffe, auf der Suche nach den Schatzinseln .. Der Weg ist das Ziel und der ist 
nicht so einfach. Würfel und navigiere Dich durch die Meere und finde die 
verborgenden Schätze vor den anderen!

Ein kurzweiliges schnelles Spiel mit Bierdeckeln. Spaß für jedermann!

—description from the publisher (German)

Spielablauf: Am Anfang des Spielerzuges navigiert der Spieler über die ausliegende Karte (Spielplan) und versucht einen guten Navigationspunkt zu erspielen, um von dort gute Schätze zu finden.
Der aktive Spieler würfelt anfänglich beide Würfel und hat danach optional einen weiteren Wurf mit einem oder beiden Würfeln. Danach zählt das erwürfelte Ergebnis. Er hat jetzt durch die festgelegten Navigationsreihen genau 1 Spielfeld des Planes direkt getroffen (Schnittpunkt). 
Falls ein Spieler ein Inselfeld direkt oder indirekt (über ein angrenzendes Seefeld) trifft, können alle auf dieser Insel liegenden Schatzmarker sofort aufgedeckt werden. Der Spieler hat jetzt die Chance die Schätze dieser Insel zu erspielen. Der Spieler hat hier bei einem direkten Inseltreffer bis bis zu 3 Würfe, bei einem indirekten Treffer (über angrenzendes Seefeld) immer nur 1 Wurf mit den Würfeln.

Für das Erspielen von Schatzmarkern getroffener Inseln (direkt oder indirekt) gilt:
Zahlenmarker: Erzielt ein Würfel dabei die Zahl eines ausliegenden Zahlenmarkers, ist der Schatz geborgen und kann vom Spieler aufgenommen werden.
Sven Glückspilz- oder Hägar-Marker: Ein Pasch (2x gleiche Zahl, egal welche) erspielt einen dieser ausliegenden Marker.
Lucky-7 (Summe): Eine Würfelkombination mit der Summe = 7 (1/6 oder 2/5 oder 3/4) kann als Joker genutzt werden. Der Spieler kann sich einen beliebigen ausliegenden Marker der Insel aussuchen.

Das Spiel endet sofort, sobald alle Zahlenmarker (gesamt 6 Stück) geborgen sind. Der Spieler mit den wenigsten Siegpunkten insgesamt verliert das Spiel. Bei Gleichstand verlieren auch mehrere.
Jeder erspielte Zahlenmarker zählt anhand seines Zahlenwertes Siegpunkte. Dazu gibt es (für einen Spieler) ggf. doppelte Siegpunkte für einen Schatzmarker auf dem x2-Feld. 
Der Hägar-Marker bringt die Anzahl aller erspielter Zahlenmarker als zusätzliche Siegpunkte für den Spieler (neben den eigentlichen Zahlenwerten). 
Für jeden Sven Glückspilz-Marker würfelt der entsprechende Spieler beide Würfel genau 1x. Die Differenz der beiden Ergebnisse (höhere minus kleinere Zahl) zeigt die hierfür erzielten Siegpunkte. Bei einem Pasch gibt es also nichts.

Name: Citizens
Description:
Ready for a tour around the world? Discover countless details of cities around the world.

Citizens is a dynamic and fun card game. The goal of the game is to compare cities on different categories and to be the first player to get rid of all the cards. During the game you can challenge the other players in order to skip ahead one turn. You can also change categiories depending on other players´cards so you take advantage of their game. This is a playing card game based on Travel, Culture, Geography, Society and much more focused game that you can take with you anywhere.

Each player starts with several cards, which means each player starts with different cities of the world. In order to win the game, you must be the first one to place all your cards correctly on the table. Every time a player positions correctly one of their cities on the table, the comparison gets more complicated and interesting for the next player as the options increase.

To beat your opponents you don´t need to know the exact answer. Instead, you need to be the best player comparing cities according to the 6 categories of the game.  Each of them will make you think about the cities in a completely different way.
