If you love game strategies, you can decide to activate a different category for the game or even challenge other players, you can check all the details in the rulebook.

Name: Yes! We Have No Bananas
Description:
You are a hard-working immigrant produce storeowner and want to make your customers happy. Earn the most money by fulfilling customer orders while overcoming the double negatives that sometimes come with communicating through a language barrier. And above all, make it clear that you have NO bananas!

Yes! We Have No Bananas is a print-and-play card game for 2-4 players designed by Mac McAnally. It's based on the 1923 song written by Frank Silver and Irving Cohn, now in the Public Domain.

—description from the designer

Name: Catan: Szenario Der Kölner Dom
Description:
This is a Catan World Championship Köln 2018 Special. It's a scenario for the base game.

It comes with 7 cathedral parts, 7 advantage tiles, 1 game instruction and 1 3D illustration. The players have to build the cathedral. One part of the cathedral costs 1 ore, 1 brick and 1 lumber. If you pay the cost you get the next part of the cathedral and an advantage tile. After cathedral construction is completed, the player with the most advantage tiles receives 2 victory points.

—user summary

Name: Disney Babies
Description:
An easy to learn game for 2-4 players, featuring the delightful Disney Baby characters. The game teaches recognition, matching and simple strategy.

The goal is to be the 1st player to fill his bingo card by completing the 3 sets of 3 Disney Babies cards.

—user summary

Name: Escape the Dark Castle: The Collector's Box
Description:
An expansion in its own right, the Collector’s Box contains a wealth of new, fan-driven game content for Escape the Dark Castle while also providing stylish and practical storage for your entire collection.

With it’s sturdy, matte black box and minimal spot UV detailing, the imposing exterior of the Collector’s Box hides an elegant storage system within. Now you can store every item in your Escape the Dark Castle collection in one box with ease. The custom insert lets you organise your cards by set, type, or however you see fit, by simply sliding them into the rows of dedicated card slots – sleeved or unsleeved. Space is included to hold the entire collection, including all rulebooks, scorepads, pencils, books and playmats - with a little extra space set aside for future expansion.

The Collector's Box comes with a bonus expansion inside, including:

6 New Boss Cards
An array of powerful new foes, each with a unique and devious mechanic

12 Character Flaw Cards
Incarceration has changed the prisoners for the worse, but can their flaws help them overcome the evil they are about to face?

4 Death Dice
Used to make combat even tougher for those seeking a greater challenge.

2 New Start Cards
Now you’ll never know exactly how your adventure will begin.

2 Epilogue Cards
Whether you escape or not, get complete narrative closure to every quest.

1 New Relic & Die 
The Living Stone, giving prisoners a chance at resurrection when all seems lost.

4 Health Trackers with metal Skull Markers 
An optional alternative to the scorepad & pencil system.

1 Dice Bag
Store all the game’s beautiful dice in one satisfying pouch.

1 Metal “YOU” Token 
Used to help keep track of which prisoner is taking the lead each chapter.

4 Rules Reminder Charts 
A handy reference to help new players remember what everything means.

Does not include Escape the Dark Castle main game.

A copy of Escape the Dark Castle is required to use this expansion.

Name: The Alwaysgreen Garden
Description:
Magical animal gardeners work with you in their enchanted garden as you create the best menu of unique forest dishes competing to become the new head chef of the Acorn Inn.

The Alwaysgreen Garden is a unique mix of worker placement, tableau and resource management, with a pinch of engine building for spice. The game features a dynamic play area that changes with each player interaction. Your goal is to harvest ingredients and work with the magical animal gardeners to make the most fantastic table of recipes!

Players all start the game with two recipe cards, two skill cards and a unique menu card. Additional recipes and skill cards can be acquired during play. However, your menu card stays with you throughout play, giving you a special end-of-game scoring multiplier if you achieve certain combinations. Up to three recipe cards can be placed in your kitchen area while you collect ingredients. Once you've gathered the necessary ingredients for a recipe, you can present it to a gardener (more about that below). Skill cards are played directly from your hand, giving you extra actions, bonus ingredients or can add to your points at the end of the game.

Four (or five) garden patch tiles make up the board. Each garden patch grows different ingredients, vegetables, fruit, fungus and grains/nuts. Each turn ingredients randomly grow in these garden patches dictated by a roll of the garden dice. Four (or five) magical gardener animals tend the garden, though each has one particular patch that they are partial to. These animal figures are placed on the board in their preferred garden patch to start the game. Players take turns moving their token to different garden patches, harvesting the ingredients and interacting with the gardeners. You can present your completed recipe to the gardener on your patch or call a different gardener to your patch to use their special ability. You can't do both.

As the gardener animals are called to different patches and different ingredients grow or are harvested, players have unique options every turn! You'll constantly be guessing where the gardeners will land and hoping there will be enough ingredients available to complete another recipe. Strategy, clever resource management and a bit of luck is needed to ensure you maximize each turn!

Recipe cards, toppings, combos and your unique menu card all contribute to your victory points! After one player finishes their sixth recipe, the other players have one last turn to create a final masterpiece. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins!

Concept by Ruthie Jones. Mechanisms and art by Darryl T. Jones.

—description from designer

Name: Lucky Cat
Description:
Lucky Cat is a highly interactive, cozy dice game.

Once upon a time, there was an evil king who only loved one thing — science.  He destroyed everything superstitious in his kingdom. All the lucky cat statues were smashed — except one! Shortly after, everyone became cursed and a giant fire ravaged everyone’s homes.

In Lucky Cat, 1-5 friends play as ambitious merchant cats competing to lead the once-thriving kingdom. 
Take turns rolling chunky dice that can help or hinder the whole table. Will you play it safe, pay taxes, and carefully reconstruct the lost pieces of ancient lucky cat statues? Or will you take calculated risks, amass hidden wealth, and outsmart your rivals? The people need a new leader. Are you the one?

To win: 
Be the first player to have 10 gold.
OR
Be the first player to have 2 sets of lucky cat tiles.

The dice have three faces that give you different resources: coins, broken cat tiles, and reroll cubes. The other faces give money to other players, levy taxes, or let you invest your money in your store (hiding it from the government). The more taxes everyone pays, the more dice everyone gets to roll as the city is rebuilt. The reroll cubes work on yourself as well as other players rolls.

Optional Dexterity rules: In the center of the table, a lucky cat plushie beckons. If any player rolls two cat or two crown symbols, be the first to hit the plushie and you get the broken cat tiles or avoid the heavy tax! Move Fast!

Advanced variable power tiles allow you to manipulate the dice, your cash, and your luck. Take-that advanced powers are entirely optional to include or not. Variable starting conditions allow experienced players to draft different starting resources.

Lucky Cat was designed for big or small groups of diverse friends. There are many paths to victory: strategy, speed, luck, bluffing, and even negotiation. How will you win?

-description from designer

Name: Emmerlaüs: Alliés
Description: Sometimes even magicians need Allies in life. So be it, by magic, now! This expansion (25 cards) of Emmerlaüs : Duel of Mages add powerful character cards that join you to fight your opponents, as well as different basic cards.

Name: Emmerlaüs: Compagnons
Description: Sometimes even magicians need Compagnons in life. So be it, by magic, now! This expansion (25 cards) of Emmerlaüs : Duel of Mages add useful familiar characters cards that join you to fight your opponents, as well as different basic cards.

Name: Emmerlaüs: Sorcellerie
Description: This extension (50 cards) of Emmerlaüs: Duel of Mages adds a new category of action, sorcery cards. If the health point sacrifice does not scare you, your attacks will be strengthened!

Name: Dark Rituals: Malleus Maleficarum – The Cursed Fjord
Description:
This expansion includes new Heroes, new Creatures and Minions, and a previously unseen Witch, Skriga, and her Werewolf familiar Accalia. Comes complete with 4 new double sided map tiles that add water barriers to the game as well as 5 new Encounters for this new land.

Skriga paddled her boat idly. Life at sea suited her fine. Sure, there were no stupid minions to kick, but no Demons to kick her either. And plenty of fish! Leave them in the bottom of the boat for a couple of days and they get really tasty. Sea dragons would fetch the really ugly fishes from the depths, if you shout at them loud enough. Ugly ones tasted best and it felt good to push the sea dragons around. They were so full of themselves! Anything could swim. She could learn if she wanted to.

Looking up she saw a storm brewing, small but close. Perfect, everyone likes a little rain in their face, trickling down their backs. She turned the boat to head towards the better weather. 

As she paddled, it became clear this was not a simple storm. Water splashed and circled in the air, the vortex moving towards her faster than she moved towards it. Then it was upon her, and everything changed. She was under the water, not on it, and her precious boat was torn to pieces around her. And it was cold, so cold. As she floated towards the dim and strangely diffuse light above her, the cold dragged her mind to a dark, silent place. And then she cracked her face against the sheet of ice above her.

Trapped beneath the ice for decades, Skriga could barely be called alive. Frozen in place, she was too chilled to draw power from Neemoss but the fading tendrils of her magic could feel the dead and drowned around her, together with the rotting flotsam and jetsam that is human decay. Her slowed thoughts could imagine new spells to use her surroundings to her advantage and when the ice began to thaw, she was a new Witch. We might call her a necromancer, although she had no name for what she had become.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rory's Story Cubes: Atomic
Description:
An expansion to the creativity game Rory's Story Cubes. This set includes 3 new dice with 18 thematic actions.

This expansion can be played on it's own or in combination with the original game.

The game is useful as an aid to creative problem solving, language learning and story telling. Players roll the dice and then tell a story using the actions. "Once upon a time..."

Name: Terristories
Description:
You play a member of a colony who just arrived on a new planet. You go to discover this territory as hostile as surprising, to try to settle permanently. Can you get along with other players to achieve your goals?
A semi-cooperative management and negotiation game developed in partnership with a scientific research center.

You start by choosing a planet and a goal (which consists in levels of social, economics and ecology you need to meet to make the planet viable).

Each player choose a role from the four available ones and take their own stack of projects and one individual objective, all specific to their role.

Each turn is composed of 6 phases
Phase 1 : Players increase their influence by spending resources to add people or stations to the planet.
Phase 2 : Players choose a project from their hand. Everybody then discusses to choose only one to fund.
Phase 3 : Players collect resources (1 or 2 if on a tile with one of their stations). If the last resource of a tile is taken, then it is turned over and it will not produce any resource anymore.
Phase 4 : During this phase one event (negative or positive) happens. Negative ones can be countered with sustainable development tokens (gained thanks to some projects)
Phase 5 : Players pay one resource for each of their people on the board.
Phase 6 : The planet regenerates its resources (1 or 2 per tile)

If a player meets his individual objective, he wins alone, if the main goal is achieved, everybody wins, if neither of these conditions is met before the end of the eighth turn then everybody loses.

Name: Rory's Story Cubes: Arcade
Description:
An expansion to the creativity game Rory's Story Cubes. This set includes 3 new dice with 18 thematic actions.

This expansion can be played on its own or in combination with the original game.

The game is useful as an aid to creative problem solving, language learning and story telling. Players roll the dice and then tell a story using the actions. "Once upon a time..."

Name: Rory's Story Cubes: Disaster
Description:
An expansion to the creativity game Rory's Story Cubes. This set includes 3 new dice with 18 thematic actions.

This expansion can be played on it's own or in combination with the original game.

The game is useful as an aid to creative problem solving, language learning and story telling. Players roll the dice and then tell a story using the actions. "Once upon a time..."

Name: Traveller Ascension: Imperial Warrant – Expansion 1
Description:
An add-on that was originally available during the Traveller Ascension: Imperial Warrant Kickstarter campaign.

This is the 3-4 player expansion for Imperial Warrant, including all the components to add 2 more players and a scenario book of 3 and 4 player scenarios. Contains 4 new factions (006 through 008).

Contains enough system tiles to build an additional 7 star systems with 88 additional system panels to represent those systems. Includes 32 more Action cards, 7 more Secret cards, and additional Ship and Asset cards. 10 Additional scenarios have been added so you can immediately jump into a larger engagement.
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: Adventure Party: Les Compagnons du Roi Norgal
Description:
Adventure Party is an initiation role-playing game whose scenarios will fascinate all ages. To discover with friends or family.

Save the realm of evilness, roam the legendary sites in search of elemental treasures, visit the empire above the clouds to complete the forgotten quest, resist the oppressor and rescue the king ... Answer the call of adventure!

In Adventure Party: The Companions of King Norgal, choose your character and go on an adventure: Thorin the dwarf warrior, Ithilienne the elf archer, Oloris the magician, Ser Eldarion the knight, Ikanne the spy and many others.

Adventure Party offers cooperative scenarios: in each plot, the group of players is entrusted with a mission that he can not accomplish without helping each other. The game will be successful if this quest succeeds and all characters survive.

—user summary

Name: Win!Cha
Description:
You are the new manager of the football club - many sporting and strategic challenges are ahead of you!
Buy football players, invest in the expansion of the stadium, play matches.
Make decisions that will ensure your development and your team win in the final match!

Winning is a challenge!
—description from the publisher

There is an easy and advanced version.
In the easy version you try to buy the best players for your team and win the cup.
The advanced version features lots of club improvements, direct player transfers, player salaries, coaches and spectators.

—user summary

Name: L'Osti d'jeu: De père en flic 2
Description: A promo pack of cards for L'Osti d'jeu release for the first weekend in movie theater of the movie : De père en flic 2.

Name: The Overtime
Description:
The player is one of employee who works in a black company. In this company, there is a strange custom that someone who left in the company until the end on Friday somehow also go to work on weekends. Let's smartly adjust your office hours to avoid Friday's survival.

The flow is simple. People who hand out five cards at a time and who sent out the latest leave time card will receive one stress token and will be the next start player.

Monday to Thursday are still relieved, the problem is overtime on Friday (that is the last one). If you remain on the company until late on Friday, you will be confirmed on Saturdays and Sundays and lose one precious life token. When the life token becomes zero ... ... I do not talk deeply any further. Anyway, at that point the game will end.

Players will accumulate stress tokens, but if they had three or more stress tokens as of Friday ...... Good news (or perhaps a bit new). If you collect three or more stress tokens and enter Friday, you will be caught in a stress check and you can rest. Furthermore, you can recover one lost life. What you should have is reasonable stress.

Also, there is a last train break. It is only possible to leave work after the last train after someone has missed the last train on that week. If someone misses the last train, "Ah, I can work even after the last train ..." is the same as reality wrapped in air feeling. Is not it?

Name: Dungeon Degenerates: Guide To The Würstreich – Tomb Lake & The Wetlands
Description:
Tomb Lake & the Wetlands is a shambling chaperone into this soggy sector of stale swamp. Take a closer look at the stagnant stench surrounding the Black Tree, ponder the eldritch origins of the stone circle & gaze into the ghastly gulf of Tomb Lake! Tomb Lake & the Wetlands is full color, lavishly illustrated with lurid descriptions of the Würstreich, its history, culture & denizens - with 4 NEW MISSIONS INSIDE! Really adds another dimension to your game play. 32 pages, pamphlet style.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dungeon Degenerates: Guide To The Würstreich – The Badlands & Beyond
Description:
The Badlands & Beyond is a ghoulish guide to the landmarks & lifestyles of the Würstreich’s nastiest & nameless. Tour the magic mangled moor & discover its brutality & barbarism, from the smelly Goblin Fortress to the smellier Blasted Heath! The Badlands & Beyond book is full color, lavishly illustrated with lurid descriptions of the Würstreich, its history, culture & denizens - with 4 NEW MISSIONS INSIDE! Really adds another dimension to your game play. 32 pages, pamphlet style.

—description from the publisher

Name: Green
Description:
Material: Board, 24 neutral tiles, 100 tiles per player (green and black)

Every player gets the tiles of one colour and 12 neutral tiles.

On his turn the player first may place any number of neutral stones on the board. Then he must place one tile of his own colour.

A tile may either be placed on a vacant square on the board or at the top of 4 other tiles. So the tiles will build a pyramid.

Neutral tiles however may not be placed at the outer border of the pyramid. So, at the bottom level the neutral tiles only may be placed in the inner 6x6 square, at the second level in the inner 5x5 square, and so on.

A player wins if he connects the two opposite edges of his colour with a continuous area (if seen from above, diagonal connections don't count).

To reduce the advantage of the first move the pie rule is used. After the first players turn the other player may choose to change colour. So the first player should make a move not too strong and not too weak.

Name: Munchkin Dungeon: Side Quest
Description:
Sub-Quest for the dungeon:

When you play with this expansion, a number of Side Quest gets opened. To complete them you'll have to do some nice things like "Be defeated" or "Defeat a Roaming Monster without using rerolls (ha!)."

...But Why...
You wouldn't normally go out of your way to fulfill these annoying quests, right?Here's the catch: as you complete them, you gain Levels! Keep in mind they're open information so other Heroes may have their eyes on them, too!

Name: Munchkin Dungeon: Cthulhu
Description:
Bringing Cthulhu Madness to Munchkin Dungeon:

It is time to face the Horrors with Munchkin Dungeon: Cthulhu! This expansion brings not only the big tentacly Elder God himself, but brand-new Room cards, new outer-wordly Loot cards, and Threats from another dimension! It’d be fine if they weren’t messing with YOUR Dungeon and preventing YOU from getting the precious Loot!

Munchkin Dungeon: Cthulhu comes with:


     5 Miniatures
     20 Madness tokens
     24 Threat cards
     12 Room cards
     24 Loot cards


—description from the publisher

Name: Kombina in the Knesset
Description:
You are a candidate for the Prime Minister of Israel, trying to form or join a winning government by manipulating, bluffing, or inciting your way to power. Will you play according to principle and form a consistent government, or pull a "kombina" to stay in power?

In Knesset Kombina, players compete as Prime Minister candidates from different political blocs trying to form a winning government. Playing cards represent Ministers of the Knesset (MKs) who can provide the government they join with a certain number of votes and/or actions.

Players can try to form a government independently or by forming a coalition with another player. Gameplay ends when a government is formed.

—description from the designer

Name: Jaleo
Description:
Jaleo is a loaded Spanish word which basically means a muddle. On this ever-expanding board muddled with discs, add, stack, and move them to create 4-in-a-line!

COMPONENTS

- 28 hexagonal red tiles
- 16 black discs
- 16 ‘ice’ discs (white)

HOW TO WIN

Make a four-in-a-line with your discs and/or your stacks (i.e. four-in-a-line when viewed from above).

GAMEPLAY OVERVIEW

Place four tiles together to form a diamond-like shape in the middle of the playing surface. Set the rest of tiles aside as a pool. Each player selects a colour. Take the 16 discs of your colour. Select a first player.

Players take turns during the game until, at the end of a player’s turn, someone has won (whether it’s their turn or not). On your turn, you will either stack, add, or move. If you can stack, you must stack; otherwise, you can choose whether to add or move.

Stack (mandatory): If at the beginning of your turn, two or more of your single discs are adjacent to one another, you must stack one of those single discs atop an adjacent single disc of yours. Your turn is done.

-description from publisher

Name: Blinq
Description:
Blinq (Binary + link) is a connection game that uses dual coloured square tiles composed of two rectangles and shared by both players.

Players alternate turns placing those blocks according to some simple stacking rules, each trying to connect the two sides of the board of her colour. Notice that on their turn, players play both colours at once, as the blocks are indivisible.

EQUIPMENT

There are two editions of Blinq:


     Basic: 30 dual-coloured blocks and a 4×4 board printed in a carrying bag.
     Advanced; 54 dual-coloured blocks, a special ‘neutral’ block and a carrying bag with a 4×4 board printed on one side, and a 5×5 board on the other.

Name: Robot Barbarossa:  Russian Front 1941
Description:
This would be a very conventional 11 hexes Warsaw to Moscow monthly turns corps-to-army level Barbarossa game ... except for its either-way solitaire and unknown OVERALL Russian tank and strengths and order of battle mechanic, which can throw either Axis or Russian plans and play to the wind.

Before the game, you sort the Infantry and Tank units into 3 separate upside-down/secret arrays each and pull one each out (not knowing which one) so you have left (for each branch):

a Strong + Weak = Medium - "Historical," sort of :-) - overall or
a Medium + Weak = Weak overall or
a Strong + Medium = Strong overall strength.

OR you can just blindly Bell-Curve select 36 (of the 54) Russian rifle/infantry armies and 18 (of the 27) tank/mechanized korps and tally up their strengths at the end of the game to find out how strong over all they *were*.

Of course, in one game the tanks may be Strong and the infantry Weak, etc., etc.
And even a live Russian player doesn't get to know his overall infantry strength until the game is over ... although after the 4th or 5th month he may have a good idea.

At the end of the game when the strengths are discovered (and/or suspicions confirmed) compensatory victory points are awarded if the Russians are found to have been Strong or Weak in their rifle/infantry and/or tank forces.

The point of this being that the Axis historically didn't know the overall strength(s) of the Russian units when they invaded - how hard to push and take risks - and an Axis (or Russian) player shouldn't in a Barbarossa *game* either.

There are 3 army group - Army Group North, Army Group Center, and Army Group South - and front - Northern, Western, Southwestern - sectors, to keep the robots' advancing/attacking and defending operations in line. A team can therefore be as many as 3 (cooperating) players.

It still can be a good little 2-player (or 2-team) game or you could even have the game play itself and move the pieces for it. :-)

(Writing the rules - Robot Directives - for a solitaire hex-and-counter game is VERY challenging ... a designer's holy grail.)

If you are the/a "live" Axis player, watch out for the 2-factor ("T-34&KV-1") Russian mechanized corps, which by the rules take down the German panzerkorps in the exchanges - even on an X/2 result - and you don't know whether you'll be facing 2, 4, or 6 of those. :-)

Note the stand-up mechanized korps pieces for "live" Russian players.

—description from the designer

Name: Dragon Brew: Promo Pack
Description:
A 17 card expansion adds two additional player races.

Each race in this expansion has 8 race cards.


     8 Highborn race cards
     8 Dragon Folk race cards
     Promo Pack power summary card


Highborn
You may clear the drafting pool without paying one gold.  You may clear the drafting pool before or after performing your draft action.

Dragon Folk
The gold cost for event cards drafted during the drafting action is reduced by one gold.  There is no minimum drafting cost for an Event or Brewery card.

Name: Dark Rituals: Malleus Maleficarum – The Spider's Brood
Description:
Dark Rituals: The Spider’s Brood is a mini-expansion that contains everything you need to add a new Witch and her Minions to all your games.

Karakurt sat in the corner of her lair, enjoying a moment of contentment, gnawing on a leg bone. Yes, sometimes life could be really good. Her lair was nice and damp. Her mates’ leg bone was still juicy. Her babies skittered around the web-lined tunnel, too small to do any harm, but big enough for a sweet meal soon. Life has its moments.

A spiderling abruptly turned and ran towards her. Happy days! Her claw snapped out to pierce its abdomen. A succulent dessert would be the perfect end to the meal. As she raised the oozing creature to her mouth, she caught sight of a disturbance near the entrance to her web tunnel. It was not just this one spiderling that was running wild, the whole brood was acting up.

In the dim light, she finally saw it. A slight swirling disturbance in the air, slowly advancing towards her. Was some crazy witch attacking her, in her lovely home?  The audacity! Then suddenly it gained pace, sweeping down the passage towards her. It cleared everything in its path, all the bones, bodies and babies disappearing into the swirling void. With nowhere to go and no time to think, Karakurt stared at the portal, venom dripping impotently from her fangs, as the Conjunction encompassed her.

Suddenly the pain was dreadful! Bright lights burned her eyes! Pleasant smells assaulted her nostrils! A dry warm breeze played across her sensilla hairs! She had never known such discomfort. What could be happening?

—description from the publisher

Name: Mots Cochons
Description:
This is your chance to wake up the sex beast that lies in you or hides in your pants ... all without having to lower them. In short, no need to touch to make fun! Speak dirty, mime dirty and draws dirty to score like a champion.

How's it going?

     Divide your gang into two teams.
     Choose the sex beast of your team, it's this player who dominates for the game turn.
     You draw a card. There are three types of cards: Find the dirty words, Naughty expression, Think dirty.


Who starts? It's the team whose members have had the most sex lately ... And it's not always the ones we think!

—description from the retailer
